RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Special Weight Purse 24300. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ASCENDANCE was bumped at the start, chased the leader three then two wide into the stretch, made the lead before the furlong marker under left handed urging and drew clear. MANSION PARTY away alertly, set the pace two wide then along the inside into the stretch and was no match for winner. REVENGE TOUR allowed to settled, moved up along the rail through the far turn then leveled off. CUSSIN N FUSSIN had good early speed along the inside, shifted to the four path on the backstretch, remained a sharp threat into the stretch then weakened. ENDOW well placed, failed to respond. FOX CREEK was no factor. GOLDEN BUCK broke inward bumping the winner at the start and trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Cussin N Fussin
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta's Racing Stable and Marchosky Ernest
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside speed, shifted 4path backstretch, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Mansion Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace upper stretch, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Ascendance
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, chased 3-2wide, perfect trip, going away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 12100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GIZMO'S MISSION away alertly, set all the pace and widened through the stretch under mild right handed urging to win as much the best. MR. CELLULAR chased the winner two wide and finished well clear for second in the four path. MR LAOBAN was bumped at the start, moved up three wide on the far turn then leveled off. NATURE OFTHE BEAST chased the winner along the inside, shifted out entering the stretch to the four path and finished evenly. BELL CURVE was bounced around between horses at the start, tailed into the stretch and passed tiring rivals along the rail. ALTAIR broke inward causing a chain reaction of bumping to his inside then was through after half. SECRETARY OF WAR also bumped at the start, was no threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Gizmo's Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led throughout, full of run, much the best,

ENTRY.NAME: Bell Curve
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped between horses start, passed tiring rivals rail

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Laoban
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, middle move, 3 wide, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Altair
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke inward, bumped start, through after half,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 21600. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 27. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOUGS MORNING PICK trailed early, shifted outside on the turn, the rider lost his whip at the top of the stretch, circled his field under a strong hand ride in the six path and got up in the in final stride. OAKEN battled for the lead two wide into the stretch, made the lead, set the balance of the pace under strong pressured and held firm under left handed urging. PRIVATE DRIVE vied for the lead three wide into the stretch, drew on near even terms for the lead two wide, matched stride to the wire and just missed in a game effort. OL' NED hopped at the start, moved up four wide in the turn then failed to sustain that bid. PLATE IT UP failed to menace. SURROUNDER had good early speed then faded. IT'SGOODTOBESEEN dueled for the lead along the inside to the top of the stretch then was used up.

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Dougs Morning Pick
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, lost whip top lane, circled field, up in final strides,

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Oaken
ENTRY.COMMENT: battled 2 wide, led late, held firm

ENTRY.NAME: Ol' Ned
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, middle move 4 wide, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Private Drive
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, 3 wide, long drive, just missed,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 14300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEEPINJUSTICE saved ground into the turn, shifted out wide wide nearing the top of the stretch, circled her field to make the lead near the sixteenth pole and edged clear under brisk handling. VAVITE settled along the rail, stalked the top trio past the quarter pole, slipped through to make the lead at the top of the stretch then was no match for the winner in the final stages. CREATIVE CADENCE drifted to the five path while making the lead soon after the start, set a pressured pace off the rail past the five sixteenth pole, gave up a narrow lead, kept on until deep stretch then weakened. DULCE VICTORIA pressed the pace three then four wide until mid stretch and faded late. POLITICAL ASTRAY pressed the pace two wide for three furlongs, led between calls, had speed into the stretch then came up empty. THE STEWARDS POSTED THE INQUIRY SIGN BUT TOOK NO ACTION.

ENTRY.NAME: Creative Cadence
ENTRY.COMMENT: drifted 5path early, set pace off rail, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Vavite
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, got through top lane, led, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Sweepinjustice
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground early, shifted 5w top lane, circled field, driving

ENTRY.NAME: Political Astray
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, led between calls, empty,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: C V JERSEY BEE chased the pace along the inside into the turn, shifted two wide, rallied to make the lead near the quarter pole, widened into the stretch under mild right handed urging and prevailed under a hand ride. CIRO THE BOSS never far back, had a mild late rally in the six path and finished well clear for second. STORMED OUT made the lead soon after the start, set the pace for nearly a half, remained a sharp threat into the stretch and faded late. EL SORDO passed tiring rivals two wide. MAILS HERE moved up three wide on the turn then leveled off. ROUGE TU RICHES was no factor. MOR CRAFTY broke awkwardly and was no threat. CAN'T CRASHMYPARTY had brief speed. PAYMASTER GENERAL was through early. SQUEAKY CLEAN flashed speed and stopped. JAYDEN'S PRINCE showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: C V Jersey Bee
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, angled out turn, 2 wide, lead 1/4 pole, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Paymaster General
ENTRY.OWNER: JK Stable LLC and Barker Scott W

ENTRY.NAME: Stormed Out
ENTRY.OWNER: Born To Run Farm and Cline Robert C
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, set pressured pace 1/4 pole, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Ciro the Boss
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, mild rally 6path, second best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Special Weight Purse 24300. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KERLO'S CAUSE never far back, closed willingly four wide through the stretch under left then right handed urging and got up in the final strides. BEAUTIFUL SUMMER stalked the early, pace, rallied three wide through the turn to make the lead in upper stretch, dug in determinedly but couldn't handle the winner. NOT TODAY dueled for the early lead two wide, shook clear on the turn, set the pace to the top of the stretch then was outfinished. SURF HAPPY failed to menace. BIG R. NAUFFAL battled for the lead along the inside into the turn and was through after a half. LUNA PRIMAVERA had brief speed two wide. KAYLEIGH'S KITTEN was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Surf Happy
ENTRY.OWNER: Dean Janice Walder Dan Walder Shelby Laconelli Mike Laconelli Becky Lyon Ben and

ENTRY.NAME: Beautiful Summer
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rallied 3 wide turn, led, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Kerlo's Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, closed willingly, 4 wide, up in final strides,

ENTRY.NAME: Not Today
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled, 2 wide, clear lead turn, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 26400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 27 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CENTSOFWANDER always within striking distance while saving ground, rallied through the stretch to make the lead inside the furlong marker and proved best under a strong hand ride. MORETHANREADYEDDIE away alertly, set the pace until deep stretch then couldn't handle the winner. ERNIE'S MARTINI stalked the pace three wide and went evenly. HIPPODROME pressed the pace two wide then three wide into the stretch and weakened late. CATEGORY TEN was hung five wide into the first turn then no factor. HOUSED was no threat. POT COMMITTED trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Centsofwander
ENTRY.OWNER: Fisher Teresa K and Fisher James
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, rallied rail, late lead, hand ride

ENTRY.NAME: Morethanreadyeddie
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace late stretch, second best, 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ernie's Martini
ENTRY.OWNER: Chesney, Stephen and Hoffman, Cory S.

ENTRY.NAME: Pot Committed
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 33700. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 27 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowanc es).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ORFANO never far back, closed willingly four wide to make the lead in upper stretch and drew off under right urging. I STRONG allowed to settle, loomed boldly five then four wide into the stretch and finished second best. WILDCAT PRIDE pressed the early pace two wide, led on the turn then was outfinished. CONSTITUTION COAL had good early speed along the inside, lacked room at the seven sixteenths pole then finished with good courage two wide. HOTROD BOBBY close up two then three wide, finished determinedly. SHOWTIME BOY set a pressured pace along the inside through the turn then was outfinished. MAN'S CHOICE was no threat. HARSH TRUTH showed little. YIPPEE KI YAY offered a mild bid three wide on the turn then came up empty. WHISKEY HELPS was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Constitution Coal
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside speed, no room 7/16pole, finished well, 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Hotrod Bobby
ENTRY.OWNER: DaCosta Jason and Rowe Robert A

ENTRY.NAME: I Strong
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, loomed boldly, 5-4wide, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Orfano
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, closed willingly, 4 wide, drew off, right urging

ENTRY.NAME: Yippee Ki Yay
ENTRY.OWNER: Klein Jr Samuel and Kuntz Mark D
